q1.question: How is Susan cleared as a suspect?
q1.recall: Susan takes a polygraph test and is cleared as a suspect.
q1.vectordb: Susan is cleared as a suspect after taking a polygraph test that clears her and after the arrest of her housecleaner, Philippe, who was found with a pair of Alex's bloody underpants but claimed he used them to stop bleeding after he cut himself washing dishes in Susan's house. Susan tries to persuade Menetti to drop the charges against Philippe, but he refuses, citing physical evidence he won't discuss. Susan is later contacted by a woman named Malvina Robbins who says Alex is alive and living with neighbors. Menetti initially dismisses Robbins as a crank, but when he investigates her lead, he finds a blue Chevy parked in the driveway of the neighboring house and realizes that Robbins was telling the truth. Alex is found alive and unharmed.

q8.question: How was the investigation?
q8.recall: The investigation dragged on for several months and was eventually closed, with Philippe going on trial within weeks. Graham was ruled out as a suspect after producing an alibi, but tensions arose between him and Menetti due to budget cuts forcing the command center to be dismantled. The case gained media attention and involved various leads, including a psychic, but ultimately it was the police who found Alex alive and unharmed. Susan believed Philippe was innocent and tried to persuade Menetti to drop the charges, but he refused citing physical evidence he wouldn't discuss.
q8.vectordb: The content describes an investigation into the disappearance of Susan Selky's son Alex, which drags on for months until a break in the case happens on the Fourth of July when Susan's housecleaner, Philippe, is arrested as a suspect. A pair of Alex's bloody underpants was found in his apartment, where the gay Philippe was picked up with a male prostitute. Susan visits Philippe in jail, and he tells her that the bloody underpants came about when he used them to stop bleeding after he cut himself washing dishes in Susan's house. Convinced Philippe is innocent, Susan tries to persuade Menetti to drop the charges, but he refuses, citing physical evidence he won't discuss. The investigation is closed, and Philippe goes on trial within weeks. On a day off, Menetti is taking a drive with his son when he sees a sign for Bridgeport, Connecticut, and decides to check out a lead personally. Once he is sure that the lead is false, Menetti hopes to browbeat Robbins from ever disturbing Mrs. Selky ever again. When Menetti arrives at Robbins' address, he is shocked to see a blue Chevy (in which witnesses had reported seeing Alex) parked in the driveway of the neighboring house. Realizing that Robbins was telling the truth, he uses her phone to contact the Bridgeport police. They find Alex alive and unharmed.
q8.hybrid: The investigation dragged on for several months and was eventually closed, with Philippe going on trial within weeks. Graham was ruled out as a suspect after producing an alibi, but tensions arose between him and Menetti due to budget cuts forcing the command center to be dismantled. The case gained media attention and involved various leads, including a psychic, but ultimately it was the police who found Alex alive and unharmed. Susan believed Philippe was innocent and tried to persuade Menetti to drop the charges, but he refused citing physical evidence he wouldn't discuss.
